instruction: What machine learning models were used in the study to analyze the distribution and changes in mangrove forests along the Saudi Arabian coast of the Western Arabian Gulf (WAG)?
Output: The machine learning models used in the study to analyze the distribution and changes in mangrove forests along the Saudi Arabian coast of the Western Arabian Gulf (WAG) were Supported Vector Machine (SVM), Decision Tree (DT), referred to as Classification and Regression Trees (CART), and Random Forest (RF).

instruction: How effective was the SMRI as an indicator for detecting submerged mangroves in the study of mangrove forests along the Saudi Arabian coast of the Western Arabian Gulf (WAG)?
Output: The SMRI (submerged mangrove recognition index) was found to be an effective indicator for detecting submerged mangroves in the study of mangrove forests along the Saudi Arabian coast of the Western Arabian Gulf (WAG). The results showed the robustness of SMRI in identifying and analyzing submerged mangrove forests using both high and medium spatial resolution satellite images. Additionally, the SMRI results were consistent with the distribution of mangroves observed in high-resolution WorldView-2 images. Therefore, the SMRI proved to be a reliable tool for detecting submerged mangroves in the study area.
